00:24:57,914 --> 00:25:03,461
- [ Clearing Throat ]
- I told you to stay out of here.

249
00:25:03,503 --> 00:25:07,173
So I guess you're not gonna be home
till a lot later, huh, Darla?

250
00:25:07,257 --> 00:25:11,302
She's busy. Go play with your dolls
or something, okay?

251
00:25:11,344 --> 00:25:13,680
I don't have any dolls.

252
00:25:13,763 --> 00:25:17,142
Get some food, huh?

253
00:25:17,183 --> 00:25:20,186
Somebody already bought me dinner.
The police.

254
00:25:25,900 --> 00:25:29,571
- "Somebody already bought me dinner.
The police."
- [ Laughing ]

255
00:25:39,581 --> 00:25:42,834
Thirty, forty dollars.

256
00:25:44,586 --> 00:25:47,047
Who the fuck is this now?

257
00:25:47,088 --> 00:25:51,259
Hey! Piss off!
We're closed!

258
00:25:51,343 --> 00:25:54,012
- Cerrado!
- [ Pounding ]

259
00:25:54,095 --> 00:25:57,932
Sleep it off somewhere else, dusthead,
unless you want to get mutilated.

260
00:26:03,438 --> 00:26:05,440
[ Muttering ]

261
00:26:05,523 --> 00:26:09,778
Goddamn creatures of the night,
they never learn.

262
00:26:11,488 --> 00:26:13,239
Hey! Hey!

263
00:26:15,283 --> 00:26:17,369
- [ Cawing ]
- [ Screams ]

264
00:26:17,452 --> 00:26:21,831
"Suddenly I heard
a tapping, as if someone...

265
00:26:21,873 --> 00:26:25,835
gently rapping,
rapping at my chamber door."

266
00:26:27,796 --> 00:26:30,090
What are you talking about?

267
00:26:30,173 --> 00:26:32,884
You heard me rapping, right?

268
00:26:32,967 --> 00:26:37,097
You're trespassing,
and you owe me a fucking new door!

269
00:26:39,516 --> 00:26:42,477
I'm looking for something
in an engagement ring.

270
00:26:42,560 --> 00:26:43,937
Gold.

271
00:26:44,020 --> 00:26:46,356
You're looking for a coroner,
shit-for-brains.

272
00:26:50,610 --> 00:26:55,740
Oh, shit.
Oh, shit on me!

273
00:26:55,824 --> 00:26:58,368
Shit on me.
Shit on me!

274
00:27:04,499 --> 00:27:06,751
- Aaah!
- Mr. Gideon.

275
00:27:06,835 --> 00:27:09,087
You're not paying attention.

276
00:27:12,007 --> 00:27:14,175
No! [ Screaming ]

277
00:27:14,259 --> 00:27:19,556
I repeat, a gold
engagement ring, yes?

278
00:27:21,182 --> 00:27:24,644
It was pawned here a year ago
by a customer of yours named Tin Tin.

279
00:27:27,355 --> 00:27:31,026
He confided in me
before he ran out of breath.

280
00:27:31,109 --> 00:27:34,279
[ Helicopter Departing ]

281
00:27:36,322 --> 00:27:38,324
Who's this sack of shit?

282
00:27:38,408 --> 00:27:41,369
That's Tin Tin, one of
T-bird's little helpers.

283
00:27:41,453 --> 00:27:44,497
I think you can rule out
accidental death.

284
00:27:44,581 --> 00:27:47,375
Don't any of your street demons
have real grown-up names?

285
00:27:47,459 --> 00:27:51,629
This could be a turf hit, but it doesn't
look like your usual gang crap.

286
00:27:51,713 --> 00:27:56,426
Come on, Albrecht, spare me.
You're a beat cop now, so be a beat cop.

287
00:27:56,509 --> 00:27:58,428
I'm suppose to thank you
for that, right?

288
00:27:58,511 --> 00:28:02,265
Word to the wise:
Watch your fucking mouth.

289
00:28:03,475 --> 00:28:05,894
What the hell
do you call that?

290
00:28:06,936 --> 00:28:09,522
I call it blood, detective.

291
00:28:09,606 --> 00:28:13,401
I suppose you'll write it up
as graffiti.

292
00:28:13,443 --> 00:28:16,237
You can leave
my crime scene now, okay?

293
00:28:16,279 --> 00:28:20,283
[ Helicopter Approaching ]

294
00:28:22,952 --> 00:28:25,872
- Warmer?
- What are you doing?

295
00:28:25,955 --> 00:28:28,583
- Don't you know this game?
- What game?

296
00:28:28,625 --> 00:28:31,544
Okay, the rings!
I'll tell you about the rings!

297
00:28:31,628 --> 00:28:36,007
They're in that metal box!
It's under the shelf there!

298
00:28:36,091 --> 00:28:41,596
Take the fucking rings!
Choke on them, you son of a bitch!

299
00:28:45,183 --> 00:28:47,769
- Look, it goes to the attic.
- Okay.

300
00:28:56,945 --> 00:28:58,947
No, no.

301
00:28:59,030 --> 00:29:02,158
No, no, no.

302
00:29:04,661 --> 00:29:08,873
Oh, it's beautiful.
I don't believe it.

303
00:29:12,794 --> 00:29:15,171
Shelly.

304
00:29:23,346 --> 00:29:24,723
I love you.

305
00:29:29,811 --> 00:29:32,689
[ Groaning ]

306
00:29:32,772 --> 00:29:35,692
- You have one chance to live.
- Take anything you want.

307
00:29:35,775 --> 00:29:38,862
- Thank you.
- Take anything!

308
00:29:38,945 --> 00:29:41,781
Now you're going to tell me
where to find...

309
00:29:41,865 --> 00:29:44,492
the rest of Tin Tin's
little party pals.

310
00:29:44,576 --> 00:29:46,953
The Pit. They all
hang out at The Pit.

311
00:29:47,037 --> 00:29:52,125
T-birds's little potato-heads hang out
there. Funboy lives there upstairs.

312
00:29:52,208 --> 00:29:55,211
- Funboy.
- Oh, baby, oh.

313
00:29:55,295 --> 00:29:59,049
- A whole jolly club...
- Please!

314
00:29:59,132 --> 00:30:01,885
- with jolly pirate nicknames!
- Stop! Please!

315
00:30:01,968 --> 00:30:04,637
- Jesus Christ in a taxicab!
- Hold still!

316
00:30:06,306 --> 00:30:09,684
Each one of these is a life...

317
00:30:09,768 --> 00:30:12,270
a life you helped destroy.

318
00:30:12,354 --> 00:30:14,981
I'm begging you.
Don't kill me.

319
00:30:15,023 --> 00:30:18,735
I'm not gonna kill you.

320
00:30:18,818 --> 00:30:22,989
Your job will be to tell the rest
of them that death is coming for them...

321
00:30:23,031 --> 00:30:26,576
tonight.

322
00:30:31,623 --> 00:30:35,835
Tell them Eric Draven
sends his regards.

323
00:30:37,712 --> 00:30:41,800
You walk outta here,
they're gonna erase your sorry ass.

324
00:30:41,883 --> 00:30:45,512
You're nothing but street grease,
you motherfucker!

325
00:30:45,595 --> 00:30:47,722
Is that gasoline I smell?

326
00:30:47,806 --> 00:30:50,767
No, man, no!
No!

327
00:30:50,809 --> 00:30:52,894
No!

328
00:30:52,936 --> 00:30:54,270
No!

329
00:30:57,315 --> 00:30:59,943
[ Screaming ]

330
00:31:03,279 --> 00:31:08,118
[ Screaming ]

331
00:31:09,953 --> 00:31:13,415
It's on the house, kiddo,
you know that.

332
00:31:13,498 --> 00:31:15,792
One root beer.

333
00:31:17,794 --> 00:31:20,547
[ Bartender ] I can't do anything.

334
00:31:20,630 --> 00:31:25,093
Your mom... technically,
she's off right now.

335
00:31:25,176 --> 00:31:27,303
Yeah, way off.

336
00:31:28,471 --> 00:31:31,808
[ Tires Screeching, Door Opening ]

337
00:31:31,891 --> 00:31:36,813
Police! Don't move!
I said, "Don't move!"

338
00:31:36,855 --> 00:31:39,899
I thought the police
always said, "Freeze!"

339
00:31:39,983 --> 00:31:43,903
I am the police and I say don't move,
Snow White. You move, you're dead.

340
00:31:43,987 --> 00:31:49,159
And I say I'm dead and I move.

341
00:31:49,200 --> 00:31:52,537
Not one more step.
I'm serious.

342
00:31:52,579 --> 00:31:56,958
Then shoot, if you will,
Officer Albrecht.

343
00:31:57,042 --> 00:32:00,170
What are you, nuts?
Walking into a gun?

344
00:32:00,253 --> 00:32:01,963
You high?

345
00:32:02,047 --> 00:32:05,216
- You don't remember me?
- What are you talking about?

346
00:32:05,300 --> 00:32:09,304
How about Shelly?
Do you remember Shelly Webster?

347
00:32:09,387 --> 00:32:12,057
Shelly Webster's dead, my friend.

348
00:32:12,098 --> 00:32:16,728
I want you to move over to the curb,
nice and easy. Move it!

349
00:32:16,770 --> 00:32:21,608
Okay, we're gonna
wait here for backup.

350
00:32:21,691 --> 00:32:26,154
- It's getting too weird for me.
- Oh, it gets better.

351
00:32:26,237 --> 00:32:28,656
Do you know someone named T-bird?

352
00:32:28,740 --> 00:32:33,328
He had a friend who shouldn't have
played with knives. Like the coat?

353
00:32:33,411 --> 00:32:35,997
You're the guy
that murdered Tin Tin.

354
00:32:36,081 --> 00:32:39,584
- [ Looter ] Check it out.
- He was already dead.

355
00:32:39,668 --> 00:32:45,006
- [ Glass Shattering ]
- He died a year ago.
The moment he touched her.

356
00:32:45,090 --> 00:32:48,760
They're all dead.
They just don't know it yet.

357
00:32:48,843 --> 00:32:51,262
Get away from there!

358
00:32:51,346 --> 00:32:54,474
Cops!
Get outta here!

359
00:32:54,516 --> 00:32:57,936
- [ Woman Laughing ]
- [ Looter ] Leave it, run!

360
00:33:03,316 --> 00:33:07,654
- Oh, great, great.
- [ Siren Wailing ]

361
00:33:07,737 --> 00:33:10,323
Guy shows up looking like
a mime from hell...

362
00:33:10,407 --> 00:33:12,701
and you lose him
right out in the open.

363
00:33:12,784 --> 00:33:18,623
Well, at least he didn't do that walking
against the wind shit. I hate that.

364
00:33:18,707 --> 00:33:22,627
Little early
for Devil's Night.

365
00:33:24,212 --> 00:33:26,923
You are very restless.

366
00:33:27,007 --> 00:33:30,218
Just wish I was a little
hungry again, that's all.

367
00:33:30,301 --> 00:33:34,556
- Be careful of what you ask for.
- Yeah, I may get it, I know.

368
00:33:38,143 --> 00:33:40,729
[ Sizzling ]

369
00:33:40,812 --> 00:33:44,441
** [ Rock And Roll, Indistinct ]

370
00:33:46,026 --> 00:33:49,070
There are energies
aligning against you.

371
00:33:49,154 --> 00:33:51,614
Seeing is believing,
isn't it?

372
00:33:58,538 --> 00:34:02,334
[ Door Opening, Closing ]

373
00:34:02,417 --> 00:34:05,420
Mmm, yummy.

374
00:34:10,759 --> 00:34:14,721
Gideon's pawnshop just burned down
to the foundation.

375
00:34:14,804 --> 00:34:18,016
Nobody cleared
this little event with me.

376
00:34:18,099 --> 00:34:19,851
I didn't have nothing
to do with that.

377
00:34:19,934 --> 00:34:22,604
[ Man ] You must be
awfully disappointed.

378
00:34:22,687 --> 00:34:26,024
I got trouble.
One of my crew got himself perished.

379
00:34:26,066 --> 00:34:28,360
- Yeah, who might that be?
- Tin Tin.

380
00:34:28,443 --> 00:34:33,031
Somebody stuck his blades in all his
major organs in alphabetical order.

381
00:34:33,073 --> 00:34:35,658
Gentlemen, by all means,
I think we ought to have...

382
00:34:35,742 --> 00:34:38,912
an introspective moment of silence
for poor, old Tin Tin.

383
00:34:41,581 --> 00:34:44,167
You're working for me
tomorrow night, right?

384
00:34:44,250 --> 00:34:47,045
- Whatever you say, I can do.
- Good.

385
00:34:47,087 --> 00:34:49,923
That's very reassuring.

386
00:34:49,964 --> 00:34:54,010
I still ain't heard
why Gideon's burned down.

387
00:34:54,094 --> 00:34:58,556
Is that a natural catastrophe
or act of God or something?

388
00:34:58,640 --> 00:35:00,475
Call it my need to know.

389
00:35:27,419 --> 00:35:29,295
[ Sighing ]

390
00:35:31,506 --> 00:35:34,009
[ Honking, Tires Screeching ]

391
00:35:34,092 --> 00:35:36,678
Let go, you creep!

392
00:35:40,015 --> 00:35:41,766
- Nah.
- [ Laughing ]

393
00:35:41,850 --> 00:35:45,145
You didn't even slow down,
you dickhead!

394
00:35:46,563 --> 00:35:48,940
He couldn't have stopped.

395
00:35:49,024 --> 00:35:53,319
He was a buttface.
I could have made it.

396
00:35:53,403 --> 00:35:56,448
What are you supposed to be,
a clown or something?

397
00:35:56,531 --> 00:35:58,533
Sometimes.

398
00:36:00,577 --> 00:36:05,331
It's more like surfing than skating.
I wish the rain would stop, just once.

399
00:36:06,499 --> 00:36:10,003
- It can't rain all the time.
- Eric?

400
00:36:19,346 --> 00:36:22,474
[ Phone Ringing ]

401
00:36:26,936 --> 00:36:31,524
Don't thank me.
Are we fighting the good fight?

402
00:36:31,608 --> 00:36:35,945
Double homicide a year ago.
No convictions.

403
00:36:36,029 --> 00:36:39,449
Annie... look at that.

404
00:36:39,532 --> 00:36:43,745
"We, the undersigned tenants of
1929 Caulderon Court Apartments--"

405
00:36:43,828 --> 00:36:45,872
What is this, a petition?

406
00:36:45,955 --> 00:36:48,833
Big "kick me" sign for a very nice girl
who found herself a cause.

407
00:36:48,917 --> 00:36:53,004
- The cause got her killed.
- She was fighting tenant eviction
in that neighborhood?

408
00:36:53,088 --> 00:36:58,968
Shelly Webster and her nice
rock-and-roll boyfriend, Eric Draven.

409
00:36:59,052 --> 00:37:02,597
The last time you snooped around a case
is when you got put back on the beat.

410
00:37:02,681 --> 00:37:06,685
- I know. Torres keeps reminding me.
- I bet he does.

411
00:37:13,692 --> 00:37:17,445
You're going to wind up
working a school crosswalk.

412
00:37:17,487 --> 00:37:19,614
I'm cool.

413
00:37:19,698 --> 00:37:24,452
You didn't get that file from me, okay?
And don't tell me you owe me one.

414
00:37:24,494 --> 00:37:26,996
Ah, I owe you one!

415
00:37:27,080 --> 00:37:29,124
Yeah, right.

416
00:37:29,165 --> 00:37:31,334
Damn.

417
00:37:44,931 --> 00:37:48,393
** [ Rock And Roll ]

418
00:37:56,776 --> 00:38:00,655
Tomorrow night
we can get high...

419
00:38:00,739 --> 00:38:04,409
and watch this whole fucking city
burn from that window.

420
00:38:07,245 --> 00:38:10,415
- * I am the park *
- [ Caws ]

421
00:38:10,457 --> 00:38:14,085
* I am glow *

422
00:38:14,169 --> 00:38:18,256
* In the motherfucking dark *

423
00:38:18,298 --> 00:38:20,467
* I am shocked *

424
00:38:20,550 --> 00:38:22,761
* And I see *

425
00:38:22,844 --> 00:38:26,014
* I don't want to believe *

426
00:38:26,097 --> 00:38:29,225
* No more *

427
00:38:29,309 --> 00:38:31,936
- There's a big fucking bird over there.
- * No more **

428
00:38:31,978 --> 00:38:33,980
- Huh?
- [ Cawing ]

429
00:38:35,148 --> 00:38:38,026
- It's a squab.
- [ Laughing ]

430
00:38:38,109 --> 00:38:40,737
Come here, bird.

431
00:38:40,820 --> 00:38:42,906
Hey, bird.
Hey, bird.

432
00:38:42,989 --> 00:38:45,325
Bird. B-B-Birdie.

433
00:38:45,367 --> 00:38:47,994
Here, birdie, birdie.

434
00:38:48,036 --> 00:38:51,039
Come here, birdie,
birdie, birdie.

435
00:38:53,667 --> 00:38:56,878
Birdie? Hey, birdie?

436
00:38:56,961 --> 00:38:59,547
Here, Funboy.

437
00:39:01,883 --> 00:39:03,843
What the fuck?

438
00:39:07,639 --> 00:39:10,183
[ Strumming Guitar ]

439
00:39:10,225 --> 00:39:14,771
No, man! Don't do that! You nearly
gave me a fucking heart attack!

440
00:39:14,854 --> 00:39:17,023
Look at him.

441
00:39:17,065 --> 00:39:19,943
[ Funboy ] Don't sweat it.

442
00:39:21,653 --> 00:39:24,698
It's time for you to take
your bird and leave, freako.

443
00:39:32,622 --> 00:39:37,460
Take your shot, Funboy.
You got me dead bang.

444
00:39:39,462 --> 00:39:44,384
You are seriously fucked up.
Did you look in the mirror?

445
00:39:44,467 --> 00:39:47,971
You need professional help.

446
00:39:49,764 --> 00:39:52,350
- [ Groaning ]
- Bingo!

447
00:39:52,434 --> 00:39:55,061
He shoots! He scores!

448
00:39:57,230 --> 00:40:00,233
- [ Cawing ]
- [ Laughing ]

449
00:40:01,568 --> 00:40:05,155
[ Cheering, Laughing ]

450
00:40:05,196 --> 00:40:08,908
- Jesus Christ!
- Jesus Christ?

451
00:40:08,992 --> 00:40:11,703
Stop me if you heard this one.

452
00:40:11,786 --> 00:40:14,706
Jesus Christ
walks into a hotel.

453
00:40:14,789 --> 00:40:16,708
[ Whimpering ]

454
00:40:16,791 --> 00:40:18,585
Ow.

455
00:40:20,128 --> 00:40:22,881
He hands the innkeeper
three nails and he asks...

456
00:40:22,964 --> 00:40:26,509
Don't you ever fucking die?

457
00:40:26,593 --> 00:40:28,845
"Can you put me up for the night?"

458
00:40:28,887 --> 00:40:32,390
[ Groaning ]

459
00:40:34,351 --> 00:40:38,938
- Does that hurt?
- Fuck. Does it-- Fuck, does it hurt?

460
00:40:39,022 --> 00:40:41,066
Oh, God.

461
00:40:41,149 --> 00:40:45,236
Look what you've done
to my sheets.

462
00:40:47,155 --> 00:40:48,782
[ Gun Uncocking ]

463
00:40:55,205 --> 00:40:56,956
[ Crying ]

464
00:40:57,040 --> 00:41:00,585
[ Sobbing ]

465
00:41:09,469 --> 00:41:11,471
I've got a gun
in my pocket.

466
00:41:14,516 --> 00:41:17,227
You're happy to see me,
aren't you?

467
00:41:34,994 --> 00:41:38,873
Stay away!
Stay away from me!

468
00:41:40,333 --> 00:41:42,585
[ Screaming ]

469
00:41:46,715 --> 00:41:50,552
Look.

470
00:41:50,593 --> 00:41:55,098
Mother is the name for God
on the lips and hearts of all children.

471
00:41:55,181 --> 00:41:59,936
Do you understand?
Morphine is bad for you.

472
00:42:10,363 --> 00:42:15,160
Your daughter is out there
on the streets waiting for you.

473
00:42:44,939 --> 00:42:48,610
If I wanted ice,
I would have asked for ice!

474
00:42:48,693 --> 00:42:50,945
Now fill it up!

475
00:42:52,030 --> 00:42:55,408
Fill it up yourself, macho man.

476
00:42:55,492 --> 00:42:58,161
I really need this.

477
00:43:04,709 --> 00:43:06,711
All right.

478
00:43:06,753 --> 00:43:10,715
You burn yourself
playing with matches?

479
00:43:10,757 --> 00:43:13,343
- Fuck off.
- You have an appointment.

480
00:43:13,426 --> 00:43:15,887
- Well, shit on me.
- Drink up.

481
00:43:15,970 --> 00:43:18,890
This is a first.
Do I bow or do I curtsy?

482
00:43:18,973 --> 00:43:21,768
Get my friend here

483
00:43:21,851 --> 00:43:25,271
Oh! Hey, hey, hon!

484
00:43:25,355 --> 00:43:28,274
Hey, good night, Darla.

485
00:43:30,694 --> 00:43:34,406
- You stay put right there.
- [ Groaning ]

486
00:43:42,455 --> 00:43:45,917
Get away, steamhead.

487
00:44:02,517 --> 00:44:05,103
[ Groaning ]

488
00:44:05,186 --> 00:44:07,147
Shh.

489
00:44:17,073 --> 00:44:22,829
[ Man On Radio ] As you can see, I'm
on the corner of 27th and Washington...

490
00:44:22,871 --> 00:44:25,623
- [ Door Squeaking ]
- the site of last year's biggest
Devil's Night conflagration.

491
00:44:25,707 --> 00:44:28,668
It was exactly one year ago
that the building you see...

492
00:44:28,752 --> 00:44:31,713
across the street from me
was totally demolished by fire.

493
00:44:31,755 --> 00:44:33,923
The fire that was fought
by seven fire companies...

494
00:44:34,007 --> 00:44:36,134
but lost the lives
of two fire fighters.

495
00:44:36,217 --> 00:44:40,972
In fact, if it weren't for the constant
surveillance by the local police--

496
00:44:41,056 --> 00:44:43,975
Freeze!

497
00:44:44,059 --> 00:44:47,562
Jesus. Don't ever do that, man.

498
00:44:47,604 --> 00:44:49,606
[ Whispering ] Fuck.

499
00:44:51,566 --> 00:44:53,735
Good likeness.

500
00:44:53,818 --> 00:44:57,530
I saw your body, man.
You died. You got buried.

501
00:44:57,614 --> 00:44:59,866
You still have your hat on.

502
00:45:03,787 --> 00:45:05,872
I gotta sit down.

503
00:45:06,664 --> 00:45:08,625
Shi--

504
00:45:08,667 --> 00:45:11,544
[ Albrecht ] Holy Shit.

505
00:45:13,004 --> 00:45:15,632
Say...

506
00:45:15,715 --> 00:45:20,011
are you some kind of... ghost?

507
00:45:20,095 --> 00:45:22,055
Boo!

508
00:45:29,646 --> 00:45:34,192
I don't know what I am. I need you
to tell me what happened to us.

509
00:45:36,194 --> 00:45:40,281
You took a six-story swan dive
out of a window.

510
00:45:40,365 --> 00:45:43,451
She, ah, was beaten and raped.

511
00:45:43,535 --> 00:45:48,123
Died at the hospital.
Hey, you asked, man.

512
00:45:48,206 --> 00:45:50,834
Come on. Read the file.

513
00:45:50,917 --> 00:45:55,255
Shelly Webster held on
for 30 hours in intensive care.

514
00:45:55,338 --> 00:45:58,550
Her body finally just gave it up.

515
00:45:58,591 --> 00:46:02,470
I saw it.
I couldn't do jack for her.

516
00:46:12,355 --> 00:46:14,274
- Hey.
- Don't touch me!

517
00:46:14,357 --> 00:46:18,361
- [ Sobbing ]
- Hey.

518
00:46:19,779 --> 00:46:22,615
You okay?

519
00:46:22,657 --> 00:46:25,368
I saw her.

520
00:46:26,995 --> 00:46:30,290
I saw her
through your eyes.

521
00:46:30,373 --> 00:46:32,459
You stayed with her
the whole time.

522
00:46:32,542 --> 00:46:38,006
Yeah, well, you got to
understand something, all right?

523
00:46:38,089 --> 00:46:42,844
I was hoping
she'd come out of it, you know.

524
00:46:42,886 --> 00:46:45,847
Give me something
I could work with.

525
00:46:45,889 --> 00:46:48,141
Yeah.

526
00:46:48,183 --> 00:46:50,643
Look, I--

527
00:46:50,685 --> 00:46:53,188
Why didn't you do
something about it?

528
00:46:53,271 --> 00:46:56,608
You think any people in that building,
even the ones who signed the petition...

529
00:46:56,691 --> 00:47:00,153
would talk after
what happened to you?

530
00:47:00,236 --> 00:47:03,448
I kept asking
questions and...

531
00:47:03,531 --> 00:47:06,201
finally got busted for sticking
my nose where it wasn't wanted.

532
00:47:10,205 --> 00:47:12,165
This your wife?

533
00:47:12,248 --> 00:47:16,711
Yeah, we, uh-- Well, not anymore,
we're getting a divorce.

534
00:47:18,588 --> 00:47:21,549
It's funny.

535
00:47:21,591 --> 00:47:25,595
Little things used to mean
so much to Shelly.

536
00:47:25,679 --> 00:47:29,182
I used to think
they were kind of trivial.

537
00:47:29,265 --> 00:47:32,268
Believe me,
nothing is trivial.

538
00:47:41,903 --> 00:47:46,366
You shouldn't smoke these.
They'll kill you.

539
00:47:51,037 --> 00:47:54,249
You going to vanish
into thin air again?

540
00:47:57,877 --> 00:48:00,588
I thought I'd use
your front door.

541
00:48:03,633 --> 00:48:09,472
Look, man, I'm sorry as hell for what
happened to you and your girlfriend.

542
00:48:11,016 --> 00:48:13,351
Yeah.

543
00:48:17,897 --> 00:48:20,483
- [ Door Opening, Closing ]
- [ Whispering ] Yeah.

544
00:48:20,567 --> 00:48:24,070
[ Gideon ] I got stabbed!
I shot the son of a bitch!

545
00:48:24,154 --> 00:48:27,282
I watched the bullet hole
close by itself.

546
00:48:27,365 --> 00:48:30,410
And then my business
gets blown up real good.

547
00:48:30,493 --> 00:48:33,747
- Other than that, my day sucked.
- Yeah.

548
00:48:33,788 --> 00:48:36,332
I saw him too.
He had a guitar.

549
00:48:36,416 --> 00:48:40,837
He winked at me before he jumped out
a fourth-floor window like he had wings.

550
00:48:40,920 --> 00:48:45,925
He winked at ya?
Musicians.

551
00:48:46,009 --> 00:48:48,470
- What else did you see?
- So far I haven't heard...

552
00:48:48,553 --> 00:48:51,056
shit about what you're going to do
about all this crap!

553
00:48:51,139 --> 00:48:56,644
What do I get? My livelihood
got flushed and went swirling.

554
00:48:56,728 --> 00:48:59,481
You ain't lost everything.

555
00:48:59,564 --> 00:49:04,652
Yeah, and maybe you're not
such a big shot either! Ow! Jesus!

556
00:49:04,736 --> 00:49:08,323
Fair enough. Catch.

557
00:49:09,449 --> 00:49:11,868
Aah! Jesus.

558
00:49:11,951 --> 00:49:14,371
Say hello to the last fellow
who wouldn't cooperate with me.

559
00:49:14,454 --> 00:49:16,456
What're you telling me,
this thing is real?

560
00:49:16,498 --> 00:49:20,168
All the power in the world
resides in the eyes, fella.

561
00:49:20,251 --> 00:49:24,214
Sometimes they're more useful
than the people who bear them.

562
00:49:24,297 --> 00:49:28,426
You're directly out of
your fucking mind! You know that!

563
00:49:28,510 --> 00:49:31,179
Yeah.

564
00:49:31,221 --> 00:49:36,393
Eyes see. It's one of the most important
things I learned from my sister.

565
00:49:36,476 --> 00:49:39,729
Sister? She's supposed to be
your sister? [ Laughing ]

566
00:49:39,813 --> 00:49:43,149
My father's daughter.
That's right.

567
00:49:43,233 --> 00:49:46,403
What's the matter,
you don't see the resemblance?

568
00:49:46,486 --> 00:49:48,738
Now, let's take it
from the top, friend.

569
00:49:48,822 --> 00:49:52,325
With a lot of detail.
What do you say?

570
00:49:52,450 --> 00:49:55,912
He had a bird with him.
Nearly pecked my face off.

571
00:49:55,995 --> 00:49:59,374
He told me to tell T-bird
that death was on its way.

572
00:49:59,457 --> 00:50:01,710
Whatever the fuck that means.

573
00:50:01,751 --> 00:50:05,547
Draven. He said his name
was Eric Draven.

574
00:50:06,631 --> 00:50:08,717
Want to relax
that thing now?

575
00:50:08,758 --> 00:50:13,430
This bird man, he just happened
to let you live, huh?

576
00:50:13,513 --> 00:50:17,892
You sure you ain't making all this up
just to save your own ass?

577
00:50:17,934 --> 00:50:20,645
I ain't making all this up.

578
00:50:20,729 --> 00:50:25,233
I ain't twisted
like you two fucks.

579
00:50:27,027 --> 00:50:29,154
All right.

580
00:50:33,825 --> 00:50:38,830
A boy and his bird.
Awful touching.

581
00:50:38,913 --> 00:50:42,584
Yeah. [ Laughing ]

582
00:50:49,090 --> 00:50:52,093
For fuck's sake, die, will ya?
Give me that thing.

583
00:50:59,017 --> 00:51:01,353
Thanks.

584
00:51:01,394 --> 00:51:03,688
Funboy said he saw
a black bird too.

585
00:51:03,772 --> 00:51:06,358
A big one.

586
00:51:06,441 --> 00:51:11,321
Then he choked to death
on his own blood.

587
00:51:11,404 --> 00:51:15,325
I'll have the janitor
come on up.

588
00:51:19,746 --> 00:51:21,915
[ Purring ]

589
00:51:21,998 --> 00:51:26,920
** [ Electric Guitar ]

590
00:51:38,390 --> 00:51:42,185
[ Siren Wailing ]

591
00:52:11,423 --> 00:52:17,012
- ** [ Rock Playing ]
- [ Crow Caws ]

592
00:52:17,095 --> 00:52:19,347
You again.

593
00:52:19,431 --> 00:52:21,808
You lost or hungry?

594
00:52:21,850 --> 00:52:24,686
- Hi.
- [ Caws ]

595
00:52:27,022 --> 00:52:28,940
* It can't rain all the time *

596
00:52:29,024 --> 00:52:33,528
[ Skipping ]
* Can't rain all the time *

597
00:52:42,620 --> 00:52:45,331
[ T-bird ] I don't know how many times I
gotta tell you. We're in this together!

598
00:52:45,415 --> 00:52:48,335
One part falls, it all falls!

599
00:52:48,418 --> 00:52:51,880
- You know how long it took us
to put this together?
- Yeah, a long time.

600
00:52:51,921 --> 00:52:54,507
That piece of ratshit made Tin Tin
into a fucking voodoo doll!

601
00:52:54,591 --> 00:52:56,676
Tin Tin was a dick.

602
00:52:56,760 --> 00:52:59,721
Tin Tin.
Sheesh.

603
00:52:59,804 --> 00:53:04,017
Fire it up! Fire it up!
Fire it up! Fire it up!

604
00:53:04,100 --> 00:53:06,019
Fire it up!

605
00:53:08,605 --> 00:53:10,690
No Funboy.

606
00:53:10,774 --> 00:53:14,694
Probably still...
banging away on Darla.

607
00:53:14,778 --> 00:53:17,697
- [ Grunting ]
- [ Whistles ]

608
00:53:20,075 --> 00:53:23,161
Smokes and road beers.
Be quick.

609
00:53:23,244 --> 00:53:25,246
I'm on it.

610
00:53:30,835 --> 00:53:36,132
[ Man Talking On Phone ]

611
00:53:36,216 --> 00:53:39,177
[ Sighs ]

612
00:53:43,390 --> 00:53:45,809
[ Cawing ]

613
00:53:55,902 --> 00:53:59,489
What the fuck are
you supposed to be, man?

614
00:53:59,572 --> 00:54:04,202
- [ Cawing ]
- I'm your passenger.

615
00:54:11,084 --> 00:54:13,253
Drive.

616
00:54:15,338 --> 00:54:18,299
[ Motor Starts ]

617
00:54:18,341 --> 00:54:20,135
What's all this
happy horseshit?

618
00:54:20,218 --> 00:54:22,345
- [ Tires Screeching ]
- Hey, T-bird! T-bird!

619
00:54:22,429 --> 00:54:25,682
- [ Horn Honking ]
- [ Screams ]

620
00:54:25,765 --> 00:54:27,684
[ Brakes Screeching ]

621
00:54:27,767 --> 00:54:31,021
- Oh, shit!
- What the fuck's the matter with you?

622
00:54:31,104 --> 00:54:35,108
Stupid asshair!
You hit my car!

623
00:54:35,150 --> 00:54:37,402
[ Groaning ]

624
00:54:42,073 --> 00:54:46,494
What do you want, man?
Money? Drugs? I got it.

625
00:54:48,121 --> 00:54:50,999
We could use you.
You did Tin Tin.

626
00:54:51,082 --> 00:54:54,169
- This is business, right?
- [ Gun Cocks ] Faster.

627
00:54:57,130 --> 00:55:01,343
You got that cream stuff?

628
00:55:01,384 --> 00:55:03,803
I hate this.
They can't even call it cream legally.

629
00:55:05,388 --> 00:55:08,391
- What in the crap--
- [ Tires Screech, Siren Wails ]

630
00:55:08,433 --> 00:55:10,643
[ Screaming ]

631
00:55:11,895 --> 00:55:14,731
Oh, look. Making us popular.

632
00:55:14,773 --> 00:55:17,484
When they flash us like that,
they ain't friends.

633
00:55:17,567 --> 00:55:22,989
[ Siren Wailing ]

634
00:55:23,073 --> 00:55:26,034
This is Vehicle 48. We got us
a big, old, red hot rod.

635
00:55:28,578 --> 00:55:30,747
Turn.

636
00:55:32,082 --> 00:55:34,834
You got something personal, amigo,
we can work it out.

637
00:55:34,918 --> 00:55:39,255
- Right? Huh?
- [ Crow Cawing ]

638
00:55:40,799 --> 00:55:43,301
[ Groans ]
Damn! Dead end!

639
00:55:43,343 --> 00:55:45,595
[ Cawing ]

640
00:55:48,682 --> 00:55:51,142
- [ Man ] Look out!
- [ Woman Screams ]

641
00:55:54,479 --> 00:55:56,690
Oh, my God!
Get outta the way!

642
00:56:07,784 --> 00:56:12,038
- [ Engine Rattling ]
- Holy shit! Goddamn foreign cars!

643
00:56:12,122 --> 00:56:15,667
[ Siren Wailing ]

644
00:56:15,709 --> 00:56:18,211
Shit! Shit!

645
00:56:25,343 --> 00:56:29,055
Oh, I hate this.
This ain't good.

646
00:56:30,473 --> 00:56:33,935
T-bird!
I got you, man!

647
00:56:34,019 --> 00:56:36,396
- Shit!
- [ Screaming ]

648
00:56:40,191 --> 00:56:45,196
[ Groaning, Car Door Chiming ]

649
00:56:49,784 --> 00:56:52,078
[ T-bird ] Remember?
Yeah, I remember everything.

650
00:56:52,162 --> 00:56:55,415
But I don't know what--
What? Huh? What?

651
00:56:55,457 --> 00:56:58,251
What are you talking about?
No, no, no, no, no.

652
00:56:58,293 --> 00:57:01,421
You mean that place downtown?
Yeah, I remember her.

653
00:57:01,463 --> 00:57:03,631
We needed to put some fear
into that little lady.

654
00:57:03,715 --> 00:57:06,968
She wasn't going along
with our tenant relocation program.

655
00:57:07,052 --> 00:57:10,638
And her idiot boyfriend shows up
and turns a simple sweep-and-clear...

656
00:57:10,722 --> 00:57:14,142
into a total cluster fuck!
Who gives a shit?

657
00:57:14,225 --> 00:57:17,479
It's ancient history!
Why? What do you want?

658
00:57:17,562 --> 00:57:22,484
What is it? What?
Speak to me. Speak!

659
00:57:24,069 --> 00:57:25,945
Did you send us
these complaints?

660
00:57:27,655 --> 00:57:30,992
Come here!
"Abashed the devil stood."

661
00:57:31,034 --> 00:57:33,411
Does it get you sweaty?

662
00:57:33,495 --> 00:57:38,708
I know you. I know you.
I knew I knew you.

663
00:57:38,750 --> 00:57:42,837
I knew I knew you.
But you ain't you.

664
00:57:43,004 --> 00:57:46,925
You can't be you. We put you through
the window. There ain't no coming back.

665
00:57:47,008 --> 00:57:50,470
This is the really real world.
There ain't no coming back.

666
00:57:50,512 --> 00:57:52,889
We killed you dead.
There ain't no coming back.

667
00:57:52,972 --> 00:57:57,435
[ Grunting, Muttering ]
T-bird--

668
00:57:57,519 --> 00:58:00,480
There ain't no coming back!
There ain't no coming back!

669
00:58:03,024 --> 00:58:07,195
- T-bird.
- [ T-bird Panting ]

670
00:58:07,278 --> 00:58:10,657
- [ Engine Revs ]
- "Abashed the devil stood...

671
00:58:10,699 --> 00:58:13,660
and felt how awful goodness is."

672
00:58:13,743 --> 00:58:16,621
"And felt how awful goodness is."

673
00:58:21,376 --> 00:58:25,380
[ Tires Squealing ]

674
00:58:30,677 --> 00:58:33,263
[ Gasping ]
T-bird. T-bird.

675
00:59:00,999 --> 00:59:04,294
[ Crow Caws ]

676
00:59:23,646 --> 00:59:25,940
[ Woman ] This is the 7:00 a.m. edition
of Action News.

677
00:59:26,024 --> 00:59:28,360
For over a decade,
the night before Halloween...

678
00:59:28,401 --> 00:59:32,781
has had a darker and deadlier nickname
in the inner city, "Devil's Night"...

679
00:59:32,864 --> 00:59:36,284
the name given to what has become
an annual plague of arson.

680
00:59:36,368 --> 00:59:41,748
Last year over 200 blazes were reported,
and 11 people lost their lives.

681
00:59:41,790 --> 00:59:46,961
Tonight may become the biggest
and deadliest Devil's Night ever.

682
00:59:47,045 --> 00:59:50,674
The mayor has fire fighters
from all surrounding counties--

683
00:59:50,757 --> 00:59:54,552
Do you like them up or over?
I can't remember.

684
00:59:56,596 --> 00:59:59,307
What are you doing?
I don't even like eggs.

685
00:59:59,391 --> 01:00:04,312
- Wait, you loved eggs.
- Yeah, when I was five.

686
01:00:04,396 --> 01:00:08,525
So what do you want now?
Black coffee and cigarettes?

687
01:00:08,608 --> 01:00:11,945
So what did you take
to become mother of the year?

688
01:00:11,986 --> 01:00:17,117
Oh, it wasn't drugs.
Someone kind of woke me up.

689
01:00:17,158 --> 01:00:22,956
- Who?
- Oh, it was nuts.

690
01:00:22,997 --> 01:00:28,253
You're acting weird. Did you win
the lottery or something, Darla?

691
01:00:30,755 --> 01:00:35,051
Oh, forget it. I never was
too good at this mommy shit.

692
01:00:35,135 --> 01:00:37,345
Over easy.

693
01:00:39,431 --> 01:00:44,144
I like 'em
over easy... Mom.

694
01:00:54,738 --> 01:00:56,990
Hey, Albrecht.

695
01:00:57,073 --> 01:00:59,659
[ Sighs ]

696
01:00:59,743 --> 01:01:02,662
This is the third hit
in your hood in 24 hours.

697
01:01:02,746 --> 01:01:05,999
We just fished this out of the river.
He's fused to his own car.

698
01:01:06,082 --> 01:01:10,295
- We're gonna have to l.D. his teeth.
- His name is T-bird.

699
01:01:10,378 --> 01:01:12,297
Arson was his specialty.

700
01:01:12,380 --> 01:01:14,341
Looks like he zigged
when he should have zagged.

701
01:01:14,424 --> 01:01:18,345
- Case closed.
- Bull-fuckin'-shit.

702
01:01:18,428 --> 01:01:20,680
Come here.

703
01:01:24,434 --> 01:01:26,394
You're holding out on me.

704
01:01:26,478 --> 01:01:30,023
I got a goddamn vigilante killer
knocking off scumbags left and right...

705
01:01:30,106 --> 01:01:33,360
and you're covering up
for somebody.

706
01:01:33,443 --> 01:01:35,862
Who's the cartoon character
in the painted face?

707
01:01:35,945 --> 01:01:39,824
- You're the detective. You tell me.
- Okay.

708
01:01:39,908 --> 01:01:42,035
Gideon's blows all to hell and you're
having a chitchat with some weirdo...

709
01:01:42,118 --> 01:01:44,996
who winds up in T-bird's car
when it zigs instead of zags.

710
01:01:45,038 --> 01:01:47,999
Then you steal one of
my case files from homicide...

711
01:01:48,083 --> 01:01:50,001
and you're saying this is
just a fucking automobile accident?

712
01:01:50,085 --> 01:01:52,379
- Come on!
- Yeah. Good speech though.

713
01:01:52,462 --> 01:01:54,464
I didn't want to interrupt you.
It sounded good.

714
01:01:54,547 --> 01:01:56,549
You gotta write that shit down.

715
01:01:56,591 --> 01:01:58,551
All right, smart-ass.

716
01:01:58,593 --> 01:02:01,680
The captain's got a little
love note waiting for you.

717
01:02:01,721 --> 01:02:05,684
- Welcome to the first day
of the rest of your suspension.
- Suspension?

718
01:02:05,725 --> 01:02:09,479
- For what?
- Misconduct.

719
01:02:09,562 --> 01:02:13,566
[ Dials Phone ]
Yeah, give me the lab.

720
01:02:13,650 --> 01:02:18,238
[ Thunder Rumbling ]

721
01:02:28,498 --> 01:02:30,417
[ Grunting ]

722
01:02:56,651 --> 01:03:00,530
** [ Electric Guitar ]

723
01:03:04,325 --> 01:03:06,911
[ Shelly ] One for sorrow,
two for joy...

724
01:03:06,995 --> 01:03:09,831
- Come here.
- ...three for a girl, four for a boy.

725
01:03:14,878 --> 01:03:18,673
Dancing--

726
01:03:28,892 --> 01:03:31,644
[ Paper Ripping ]

727
01:03:49,788 --> 01:03:51,748
Eric?

728
01:03:51,790 --> 01:03:54,417
[ Rain Falling ]

729
01:03:54,459 --> 01:03:58,755
[ Sighs ] Man, Sarah,
you're going crazy.

730
01:03:58,797 --> 01:04:01,758
- Gabriel.
- [ Meows ]

731
01:04:01,800 --> 01:04:04,594
I thought you were dead.

732
01:04:04,636 --> 01:04:07,931
You're not dead, are you?

733
01:04:32,706 --> 01:04:35,625
I knew it was you.

734
01:04:37,544 --> 01:04:40,463
Even with the makeup.

735
01:04:45,301 --> 01:04:47,887
I remembered your song.

736
01:04:47,971 --> 01:04:51,725
You said,
"Can't rain all the time."

737
01:04:51,808 --> 01:04:55,061
That is from your song, right?

738
01:05:04,988 --> 01:05:08,116
- [ Cawing ]
- Come on, Eric. I know you're here.

739
01:05:10,493 --> 01:05:14,581
I miss you...
and Shelly.

740
01:05:17,667 --> 01:05:21,129
Get so lonely
all by myself.

741
01:05:22,964 --> 01:05:27,594
The hell with you.
I thought you cared.

742
01:05:27,677 --> 01:05:30,805
Sarah, I do care.

743
01:05:42,025 --> 01:05:44,152
That's him.
That's him!

744
01:05:44,235 --> 01:05:47,572
But he looked different. He was painted
up white like some kind of dead whore.

745
01:05:47,655 --> 01:05:50,909
I seen him. T-bird sent me in
for some road beers, right?

746
01:05:50,992 --> 01:05:53,536
Then he took him away.
But I chased him down.

747
01:05:53,620 --> 01:05:56,414
And he flash fried T-bird
to his fucking car!

748
01:05:56,498 --> 01:06:00,001
Aw, T-bird!
Here's to you, buddy.

749
01:06:00,085 --> 01:06:04,005
Maybe we oughta just videotape this.
Play it back in slow motion.

750
01:06:05,340 --> 01:06:09,928
- Fire it up! Fire it up!
- You see the grave?

751
01:06:10,011 --> 01:06:12,597
- Empty.
- Fire it--

752
01:06:12,681 --> 01:06:14,599
Grave?
What grave?

753
01:06:14,683 --> 01:06:16,893
What about
my fucking grave?

754
01:06:16,976 --> 01:06:18,311
- [ Screams ]
- Three out of four.

755
01:06:18,395 --> 01:06:21,648
He's working his way back
to this speed freak right here.

756
01:06:21,731 --> 01:06:24,359
It's not fair.
It's Funboy's fault.

757
01:06:24,442 --> 01:06:27,612
That boy was out of control.
T-bird, he came in, he says...
[ Whistles ]

758
01:06:27,696 --> 01:06:30,990
..."Waste them both." And now
this ghost gonna kill my ass next!

759
01:06:31,074 --> 01:06:34,953
[ Groaning ]

760
01:06:35,036 --> 01:06:38,123
This ghost gonna
kill my ass next.

761
01:06:38,206 --> 01:06:41,960
- This ghost gonna kill--
- Hey.

762
01:06:42,043 --> 01:06:44,004
That ain't no ghost.

763
01:06:45,922 --> 01:06:49,092
- They have all arrived.
- Watch him.

764
01:06:49,134 --> 01:06:51,136
We might need him.

765
01:06:52,637 --> 01:06:55,098
Ghost gonna kill my--

766
01:07:07,819 --> 01:07:11,781
He like his plain
or with onions?

767
01:07:11,823 --> 01:07:15,285
Fine.
Don't talk to me.

768
01:07:15,326 --> 01:07:19,456
When someone's dead,
they can't come back, can they?

769
01:07:19,497 --> 01:07:22,125
That's what I thought.

770
01:07:22,167 --> 01:07:24,961
Are you referring
to anyone in particular?

771
01:07:25,003 --> 01:07:27,297
You'll just think
I'm nuts.

772
01:07:27,339 --> 01:07:30,967
Yeah, well, then maybe
they'll have to lock us both up.

773
01:07:31,051 --> 01:07:36,389
- You see him too?
- I saw somebody.

774
01:07:36,473 --> 01:07:39,976
Maybe it was
your fairy godfather.

775
01:07:40,060 --> 01:07:42,979
Eric didn't come back for me.

776
01:07:43,063 --> 01:07:47,817
He can't be my friend anymore
because I'm alive.

777
01:07:47,901 --> 01:07:51,071
You want a friend
to walk you home?

778
01:07:51,154 --> 01:07:56,409
** [ Electric Guitar ]

779
01:08:21,601 --> 01:08:24,604
- [ Screaming ]
- * I am the wicked
I am the wave of the future *

780
01:08:37,659 --> 01:08:39,619
[ Woman ] * Being crucified *

781
01:08:39,661 --> 01:08:43,998
* You things, things
things of the flesh *

782
01:08:44,040 --> 01:08:46,751
* Do it slow *

783
01:08:46,835 --> 01:08:51,131
* Down avenues "cut me" *

784
01:08:51,214 --> 01:08:54,884
* Lust my eyes *

785
01:08:54,968 --> 01:09:01,224
* Licking lips encouraging
Mr. Careworn *

786
01:09:01,307 --> 01:09:07,439
* To gaze upon the screen bask on *

787
01:09:07,522 --> 01:09:09,524
* After the flesh **

788
01:09:21,536 --> 01:09:25,123
[ Whimpering ]

789
01:09:25,206 --> 01:09:28,126
Boys.

790
01:09:28,209 --> 01:09:31,629
It seems our friend T-bird won't be
joining us this evening...

791
01:09:31,713 --> 01:09:33,798
on account of
a slight case of death.

792
01:09:33,882 --> 01:09:35,842
- [ Men Chuckling ]
- You wanna sit down?

793
01:09:35,925 --> 01:09:41,306
- [ Groaning ]
- Well, well, well.

794
01:09:41,348 --> 01:09:44,434
Devil's Night is
upon us again.

795
01:09:44,476 --> 01:09:46,436
I thought we'd throw
a little party...

796
01:09:46,478 --> 01:09:49,773
start a bunch of fires,
make a little profit.

797
01:09:49,814 --> 01:09:52,067
I like the pretty lights.

798
01:09:52,150 --> 01:09:54,986
[ Laughing ]

799
01:09:55,070 --> 01:09:58,990
Problem is, it's all been done before.
You see what I'm saying?

800
01:09:59,032 --> 01:10:04,245
- That's no reason to quit.
- Wrong. Best reason to quit.

801
01:10:04,329 --> 01:10:06,706
Only reason to quit.

802
01:10:06,790 --> 01:10:12,295
A man has an idea.

803
01:10:12,379 --> 01:10:14,631
The idea attracts others...

804
01:10:14,714 --> 01:10:16,800
like-minded.

805
01:10:16,883 --> 01:10:18,968
The idea expands.

806
01:10:19,052 --> 01:10:22,681
The idea becomes
an institution.

807
01:10:22,764 --> 01:10:25,433
What was the idea?

808
01:10:25,517 --> 01:10:29,270
See, that's what's
been bothering me, boys.

809
01:10:29,354 --> 01:10:32,148
But I'll tell ya, when I used
to think about the idea itself...

810
01:10:32,232 --> 01:10:35,318
it'd put a big old smile on my face.

811
01:10:35,402 --> 01:10:37,570
You see, gentlemen...

812
01:10:37,654 --> 01:10:42,659
greed is for amateurs.

813
01:10:42,742 --> 01:10:47,914
Disorder, chaos, anarchy...

814
01:10:47,997 --> 01:10:50,583
now that's fun!

815
01:10:50,667 --> 01:10:52,961
- What about Devil's Night?
- What about it?

816
01:10:53,044 --> 01:10:56,464
I started the first fires
in this goddamn city.

817
01:10:56,506 --> 01:10:59,592
Before I knew it, every charlatan
and shitheel was imitating me.

818
01:10:59,676 --> 01:11:03,138
Do you know
what they got now?

819
01:11:03,179 --> 01:11:07,475
Devil's Night greeting cards.

820
01:11:07,517 --> 01:11:10,478
Isn't that precious?

821
01:11:10,520 --> 01:11:12,647
Yeah.

822
01:11:12,689 --> 01:11:17,485
The idea has become
the institution, boys.

823
01:11:17,527 --> 01:11:19,571
Time to move along.

824
01:11:19,654 --> 01:11:22,073
You don't want us to do
"Light My Fire" time for the whole city?

825
01:11:22,157 --> 01:11:24,659
No.

826
01:11:24,701 --> 01:11:27,328
No, I want you to set
a fire so goddamn big...

827
01:11:27,370 --> 01:11:30,498
the gods will notice us again.
That's what I'm saying.

828
01:11:30,540 --> 01:11:33,168
I want all of you boys to be able
to look me straight in the eye...

829
01:11:33,209 --> 01:11:37,672
one more time and say,
"Are we having fun or what?"

830
01:11:37,714 --> 01:11:39,841
- Hey, you! What's your name?
- Huh?

831
01:11:39,883 --> 01:11:41,843
Skank!
You don't feel that?

832
01:11:41,885 --> 01:11:45,221
- I feel like a little worm
on a big fucking hook.
- [ All Laughing ]

833
01:11:45,263 --> 01:11:47,682
"I feel like a little worm
on a big fucking hook."

834
01:11:47,766 --> 01:11:52,145
Well, boy, your mama
must be damn proud of you!

835
01:11:52,228 --> 01:11:54,564
- [ Crow Caws ]
- [ Gasps ]

836
01:11:54,606 --> 01:11:57,233
How the hell did
that thing get in here?

837
01:11:58,651 --> 01:12:01,154
- Gentlemen.
- [ Skank Screams ]

838
01:12:01,237 --> 01:12:05,867
[ Skank Whimpering ] Let me go!
Let me go! I gotta go!

839
01:12:10,413 --> 01:12:14,209
You're him, huh?
The avenger.

840
01:12:14,250 --> 01:12:16,753
The killer of killers.

841
01:12:16,836 --> 01:12:19,673
- Nice outfit.
- [ Whimpering ]

842
01:12:19,756 --> 01:12:21,800
I'm not sure
about the face though.

843
01:12:21,883 --> 01:12:23,927
I just want him.

844
01:12:24,010 --> 01:12:27,430
- [ Whimpering ]
- Well, you can't have him.

845
01:12:27,514 --> 01:12:30,183
Well...

846
01:12:32,268 --> 01:12:34,729
I see you have
made your decision.

847
01:12:36,314 --> 01:12:38,274
Now let's see you enforce it.

848
01:12:38,358 --> 01:12:42,028
Aw, this is already boring the shit
out of me. Kill him!

849
01:12:47,909 --> 01:12:51,830
Ooh, that had to hurt.

850
01:12:51,913 --> 01:12:54,708
- [ All Laughing ]
- Well, that's that.

851
01:12:54,791 --> 01:12:57,961
- [ Laughing Continues ]
- That guy was crazy.

852
01:13:00,296 --> 01:13:03,133
[ Caws ]

853
01:13:04,592 --> 01:13:06,386
He's gone.
[ Screams ]

854
01:13:06,469 --> 01:13:12,142
[ Screaming, Gunfire ]

855
01:13:14,436 --> 01:13:16,146
Get him!

856
01:13:21,609 --> 01:13:25,071
- [ Whimpering ]
- [ Gunfire ]

857
01:13:33,413 --> 01:13:36,207
Right here! Here, help me!
He's gonna kill me!

858
01:13:40,253 --> 01:13:42,255
Jesus Christ!

859
01:13:58,688 --> 01:14:00,648
Hey!

860
01:14:33,181 --> 01:14:35,517
You're all going to die.

861
01:14:46,903 --> 01:14:50,448
[ Screaming ]

862
01:14:50,532 --> 01:14:53,368
[ Man ] Get the fuck outta here!

863
01:15:05,630 --> 01:15:08,216
[ Crowd Screaming ]

864
01:15:08,299 --> 01:15:13,763
[ Whimpering, Gasping ]

865
01:15:18,393 --> 01:15:23,356
[ Whimpering ]

866
01:15:23,440 --> 01:15:24,941
[ Screams ]

867
01:15:29,154 --> 01:15:32,073
Guess it's not a good day
to be a bad guy, huh, Skank?

868
01:15:32,157 --> 01:15:35,368
I'm not Skank.
There's Skank right there.

869
01:15:35,452 --> 01:15:39,330
- Skank's dead.
- That's right.

870
01:15:39,414 --> 01:15:41,207
[ Screaming ] No!

871
01:15:41,291 --> 01:15:45,754
[ Whimpering ]

872
01:15:45,837 --> 01:15:49,507
- [ Body Crashing ]
- What in the crap--

873
01:15:50,842 --> 01:15:53,470
- Don't move!
- Hold it!

874
01:15:53,553 --> 01:15:56,973
That's all she wrote!
Move and we shoot!

875
01:16:03,855 --> 01:16:06,024
[ Siren Blaring ]

876
01:16:06,066 --> 01:16:08,943
You are surrounded by police units.
Do not attempt to escape.

877
01:16:09,027 --> 01:16:12,322
[ Gunfire Continues ]

878
01:16:12,405 --> 01:16:16,034
- Stop running immediately.
- Holy shit!

879
01:16:16,117 --> 01:16:18,244
...arms and legs--

880
01:16:23,792 --> 01:16:28,588
Stop immediately.
Lie down, spread your arms and legs--

881
01:17:09,212 --> 01:17:13,842
- [ Tires Screeching ]
- Come on! Move it!

882
01:17:18,263 --> 01:17:21,391
My advice:
Next time duck.

883
01:17:23,435 --> 01:17:25,812
So many cops, you'd think
they were giving away donuts.

884
01:17:25,895 --> 01:17:29,232
- [ Sirens Wailing ]
- [ Brakes Screeching ]

885
01:17:29,274 --> 01:17:32,402
- Shit!
- [ Door Opening ]

886
01:17:35,280 --> 01:17:38,199
Oh. I knew you
were gonna do that.

887
01:17:38,283 --> 01:17:40,744
Look at that out there.

888
01:17:40,785 --> 01:17:43,747
The whole city oughta be
in flames by now.

889
01:17:43,788 --> 01:17:47,000
Sky oughta be red.

890
01:17:47,083 --> 01:17:51,421
So that, I take it,
is the late, great Eric Draven.

891
01:17:51,463 --> 01:17:57,177
He has power, but it is power
you can take from him.

892
01:17:57,260 --> 01:18:00,221
- I like him already.
- The crow...

893
01:18:00,305 --> 01:18:04,768
is his link between
the land of the living...

894
01:18:04,851 --> 01:18:07,187
and the realm of the dead.

895
01:18:07,270 --> 01:18:11,816
So, kill the crow
and destroy the man.

896
01:18:11,858 --> 01:18:13,860
Hmm.

897
01:18:36,966 --> 01:18:38,968
I'm coming home, Shelly.

898
01:18:39,052 --> 01:18:41,221
[ Laughing ]

899
01:18:41,304 --> 01:18:47,018
[ Laughing Continues ]

900
01:18:47,102 --> 01:18:49,062
[ Chuckles ]

901
01:18:53,316 --> 01:18:57,529
[ Children Laughing, Hooting ]

902
01:18:57,612 --> 01:19:01,866
[ Laughing ]

903
01:19:28,059 --> 01:19:30,520
You're gonna say
I shouldn't be in the cemetery...

904
01:19:30,562 --> 01:19:32,647
in the middle
of the night, right?

905
01:19:32,689 --> 01:19:34,482
Safest place in the world to be.

906
01:19:34,524 --> 01:19:39,320
It's 'cause everybody's dead.
I knew you'd come here.

907
01:19:39,362 --> 01:19:43,533
It's really late, Sarah.

908
01:19:43,616 --> 01:19:46,369
You didn't say good-bye.

909
01:19:46,494 --> 01:19:50,457
You're just gonna have
to forgive me for that.

910
01:19:50,540 --> 01:19:54,794
And you're never coming back.

911
01:20:01,092 --> 01:20:04,346
I gave this to Shelly once.

912
01:20:08,058 --> 01:20:11,019
I think she'd like you
to have it.

913
01:20:15,065 --> 01:20:17,359
This way you'll
always remember her.

914
01:20:17,400 --> 01:20:19,986
I'll never take it off.

915
01:20:38,129 --> 01:20:41,966
I better go sneak
back in the house.

916
01:20:48,098 --> 01:20:50,058
Bye.

917
01:21:10,036 --> 01:21:12,872
- [ Muffled Screaming ]
- Shh! Shh!

918
01:21:14,791 --> 01:21:17,210
Shh. Take it easy, sweetheart.

919
01:21:17,252 --> 01:21:22,048
[ Muffled Screaming Continues ]

920
01:21:24,134 --> 01:21:26,594
Come on.
Come on.

921
01:21:39,899 --> 01:21:44,029
What is that? Some sort of souvenir
there from your pal?

922
01:21:45,613 --> 01:21:48,742
I'll just keep it for good luck.
What do you say, hmm?

923
01:21:55,165 --> 01:21:58,460
Her eyes are so innocent.

924
01:22:09,804 --> 01:22:11,765
- [ Sarah ] Eric!
- [ Caws ]

925
01:22:11,806 --> 01:22:15,769
Eric, help! Eric!

926
01:22:19,356 --> 01:22:22,484
[ Thunderclap ]

927
01:22:24,527 --> 01:22:26,446
[ Crow Caws ]

928
01:22:40,377 --> 01:22:42,587
[ Crow Flapping, Caws ]

929
01:22:55,225 --> 01:22:58,436
Quick impression for ya.

930
01:22:58,520 --> 01:23:02,232
Caw! Caw! Bang!
Fuck, I'm dead!

931
01:23:02,315 --> 01:23:05,652
Give me the girl
and I'll let you walk out of here.

932
01:23:05,735 --> 01:23:08,780
[ Inhales ]
Well, well.

933
01:23:08,863 --> 01:23:12,617
Why don't you just give me a minute
to think about that, huh?

934
01:23:17,080 --> 01:23:19,499
[ Cawing ]

935
01:23:20,583 --> 01:23:22,877
Nah. Fuck it.

936
01:23:28,883 --> 01:23:31,261
[ Chuckles ]

937
01:23:31,344 --> 01:23:33,471
Aw, fuck.

938
01:23:36,683 --> 01:23:40,645
[ Muffled Screaming ]

939
01:23:40,729 --> 01:23:45,275
Well, well, well. It does seem to me
that our little life has undergone...

940
01:23:45,358 --> 01:23:49,195
a rather significant change in the past
few minutes now. Wouldn't you agree?

941
01:23:49,279 --> 01:23:53,450
[ Groaning ]

942
01:23:53,533 --> 01:23:56,911
Well, for a ghost,
you bleed just fine.

943
01:24:00,457 --> 01:24:02,709
- It's still alive.
- Well, then kill it!

944
01:24:04,377 --> 01:24:06,588
Bye-bye, birdie.

945
01:24:51,675 --> 01:24:53,802
Ah, shit.

946
01:24:53,843 --> 01:24:55,970
Well, just came by
to pay my respects...

947
01:24:56,012 --> 01:24:58,056
and here you are
getting all shot up again.

948
01:24:58,139 --> 01:25:00,725
- They've taken Sarah.
- How many?

949
01:25:00,809 --> 01:25:02,811
Two more.
[ Groans ]

950
01:25:02,852 --> 01:25:04,854
I can handle it.
Don't worry.

951
01:25:04,938 --> 01:25:07,482
I'm not worried.
Look, here's the plan.

952
01:25:07,524 --> 01:25:10,318
You stay in front, and when they
run out of ammo, I'll arrest 'em.

953
01:25:10,360 --> 01:25:14,114
That sounds like a great plan.
There's just one problem.

954
01:25:16,741 --> 01:25:20,286
Oh, shit.
You're bleeding all over the place.

955
01:25:20,370 --> 01:25:22,414
I thought, you know,
you were invincible.

956
01:25:22,497 --> 01:25:25,959
I was.
I'm not anymore.

957
01:25:26,042 --> 01:25:30,255
[ Sighs ] Well, I guess you really will
need my help, won't you?

958
01:25:30,338 --> 01:25:33,258
- Come on.
- [ Groaning ]

959
01:25:35,927 --> 01:25:37,971
You take that.

960
01:26:08,043 --> 01:26:11,504
- You were supposed to stay behind me.
- I think I messed up.

961
01:26:33,651 --> 01:26:35,528
[ Crow Caws ]

962
01:26:35,612 --> 01:26:38,865
This is all the power
you ever had.

963
01:26:38,907 --> 01:26:41,034
Now it is mine.

964
01:26:41,076 --> 01:26:44,788
Pity there's not more time...

965
01:26:44,871 --> 01:26:47,499
- [ Gun Cocks ]
- ...for us.

966
01:26:48,917 --> 01:26:54,673
[ Woman Screaming ]

967
01:26:56,341 --> 01:27:00,261
[ Screaming ]

968
01:27:01,596 --> 01:27:05,558
[ Screaming Continues ]

969
01:27:05,642 --> 01:27:08,478
[ Sarah ] Help, Eric!
I'm scared!

970
01:27:10,605 --> 01:27:13,149
Let me go!

971
01:27:22,242 --> 01:27:25,787
Let her go!

972
01:27:25,829 --> 01:27:28,748
You can have me.
I won't fight you.

973
01:27:28,748 --> 01:27:30,458
You can have me.
I won't fight you.

974
01:27:30,500 --> 01:27:32,502
All right.

975
01:27:32,585 --> 01:27:34,629
- [ Sarah Screams ]
- No!

976
01:27:38,425 --> 01:27:43,763
[ Gasping, Groaning ]

977
01:27:46,057 --> 01:27:48,101
[ Crow Caws ]

978
01:27:48,184 --> 01:27:50,562
[ Thunderclap ]

979
01:27:50,603 --> 01:27:52,939
[ Gasping ]

980
01:27:53,023 --> 01:27:55,150
- [ Thunderclap ]
- [ Screams ]

982
01:28:17,756 --> 01:28:20,967
- [ Whimpering ]
- [ Roof Collapsing ]

983

984

- [ Laughing ]

- Look out!

986
01:28:48,036 --> 01:28:51,539

- Eric!

987
01:28:59,547 --> 01:29:01,716
You know,
my daddy used to say...

988
01:29:01,800 --> 01:29:04,302
"Every man's got a devil...

989
01:29:04,386 --> 01:29:06,513
and you can't rest
till you find him."

990
01:29:06,596 --> 01:29:09,140
What happened back there
with you and your girlfriend--

991
01:29:09,224 --> 01:29:12,143
I cleared that building.

992
01:29:12,227 --> 01:29:15,480
Hell, nothing in this town
happens without my say-so.

993
01:29:15,563 --> 01:29:18,400
So I'm sorry if I spoiled
your wedding plans, friend.

994
01:29:18,483 --> 01:29:21,319
But if it's any consolation
to you...

995
01:29:21,403 --> 01:29:25,031
you have put
a smile on my face.

996
01:29:25,115 --> 01:29:27,742
You got a lot
of spirit, son.

997
01:29:27,784 --> 01:29:30,412
[ Unsheathes Knife ]
I am going to miss you.

998
01:29:30,453 --> 01:29:32,997

to give you.

999
01:29:33,081 --> 01:29:35,458
I don't want it anymore.

1000
01:29:39,963 --> 01:29:42,966
Thirty hours of pain!

1001
01:29:45,301 --> 01:29:48,013

- [ Groaning ]

1002
01:29:48,096 --> 01:29:51,099
- [ Steady Tone ]
- All for you.

1003
01:30:04,946 --> 01:30:08,366

1004
01:30:16,708 --> 01:30:19,878
Yeah.

1005
01:30:26,718 --> 01:30:29,554
Go help him.

1006
01:30:32,891 --> 01:30:35,185
Are you alive?

1007
01:30:37,187 --> 01:30:41,191
[ Groans ]
God, I need a cigarette.

1008
01:30:47,155 --> 01:30:49,115
Everybody else dead?

1009
01:30:49,157 --> 01:30:51,451
You helped me.

1010
01:30:51,534 --> 01:30:54,079
What you kept in here
saved me.

1011
01:30:54,162 --> 01:30:57,290
- Thanks.
- Don't mention it.

1012
01:30:57,374 --> 01:31:00,377
I've been meaning
to come to church anyway.

1013
01:31:05,382 --> 01:31:08,134
Oh, yuck.
[ Spits ]

1014
01:31:08,218 --> 01:31:13,223
I'm quitting as of now...
if I live.

1015
01:31:21,690 --> 01:31:25,151
Stay with him
until help comes.

1016
01:31:25,193 --> 01:31:28,655
He'll be okay, right?

1017
01:31:28,738 --> 01:31:30,949
Eric?

1018
01:31:32,409 --> 01:31:35,995
[ Sighs ]
He does that a lot.

1019

1020

1021

Shelly.

1023
01:32:06,943 --> 01:32:11,781

- Multiple homicides.

1024

At least it stopped raining, huh?

1025

- No, I don't believe it.

1026

- Look, you go on home.

1027

- Okay.

1028
01:32:23,501 --> 01:32:28,089

- Your vigilante's up on the roof.

1029

1030

1031

1032

1033

are stolen from us...

1034

the way to have them live on
is to never stop loving them.

1035
01:33:52,632 --> 01:33:58,513
Buildings burn, people die,
but real love is forever.
